littleroot.name: Littleroot Town
littleroot.desc: Basking amid vibrant nature, this simple town is not shaded with any one hue.

petalburg.name: Petalburg City
petalburg.desc: A whiff of salt is always in the air in this city, which is skirted by the ocean shore.

rustboro.name: Rustboro City
rustboro.desc: This city is the main hub of industry in the Hoenn region, with the Devon Corporation as its beating heart.

dewford.name: Dewford Town
dewford.desc: New trends are always the rage among the inhabitants of this small island town.

slateport.name: Slateport City
slateport.desc: People from many different regions gather and mingle in this bustling port city.

mauville.name: Mauville City
mauville.desc: This large city is located in the heart of the Hoenn region, at the crossroads of its nostalgic past and new technology.

fallarbor.name: Fallarbor Town
fallarbor.desc: A town formed by scholars who gather to research meteorites.

lavaridge.name: Lavaridge Town
lavaridge.desc: A popular spot in the Hoenn region, thanks to its hot springs, said to cure any ailment.

fortree.name: Fortree City
fortree.desc: The people and the Pokémon of this city follow nature's cues to rise each morning and end each day.

lilycove.name: Lilycove City
lilycove.desc: This tourist destination is undergoing a revival, thanks to the popularity of its Pokémon Contest Spectaculars.

mossdeep.name: Mossdeep City
mossdeep.desc: Research is underway day and night in this city, all in the hope of understanding the distant reaches of space.

sootopolis.name: Sootopolis City
sootopolis.desc: This city, which rises from the crater of a great meteoroid crash, can only be reached through the sea or from the sky.

pacifidlog.name: Pacifidlog Town
pacifidlog.desc: This town first came into being as a floating storehouse used by people living on the ocean's surface.

evergrande.name: Ever Grande City
evergrande.desc: This city is blanketed in a profusion of colorful blooms. It plays host to the grand Pokémon League.

101.name: Route 101
101.desc: This grassy path running between Littleroot Town and Oldale Town is perfect for doing fieldwork.

102.name: Route 102
102.desc: Many Trainers gather on this route in the hope of encountering Pokémon in the wild.

103.name: Route 103
103.desc: On weekends and holidays, fishing enthusiasts flock to every section of coastline on this seaside route.

104.name: Route 104
104.desc: This path, rich with water and colorful plant life, runs north and south of Petalburg Woods.

105.name: Route 105
105.desc: This water route boasts gentle currents, which makes it safe for even poor swimmers to bask in.

106.name: Route 106
106.desc: This is the site of serious battles between Fishermen of the seaside area and the wild Pokémon of the seas.

107.name: Route 107
107.desc: The local children of Dewford Town practice long-distance swimming in the waters of this aquatic route.

108.name: Route 108
108.desc: People come swimming from as far away as the Kalos region to see the site of Sea Mauville.

109.name: Route 109
109.desc: People and Pokémon alike enjoy ocean swims in this water route.

110.name: Route 110
110.desc: A timeworn path where nature remains untouched. Above it on this route stretches the huge Cycling Road.

111.name: Route 111
111.desc: This expansive route includes a desert where sandstorms rage unceasingly and a mountain pass.

112.name: Route 112
112.desc: This route is popular among Trainers because it offers the chance to stroll while gazing up at Mt. Chimney.

113.name: Route 113
113.desc: The tall grass on this route is painted a dusty gray by the volcanic ash that pours from Mt. Chimney.

114.name: Route 114
114.desc: Route 114 begins with a path leading west out of Fallarbor Town, passing the Fossil Maniac's house and several small ponds.

115.name: Route 115
115.desc: This trail to Rustboro City was broken by people who lived at Meteor Falls long ago.

116.name: Route 116
116.desc: A path that many workers take on their daily commute between Rustboro City and Rusturf Tunnel.

117.name: Route 117
117.desc: A path where many Trainers gather to raise their Pokémon and train them for battle.

118.name: Route 118
118.desc: This seaside route brings together the east and west sides of the Hoenn region.

119.name: Route 119
119.desc: If you are not prepared for it, the harsh conditions of this tropical rain forest will defeat you in less than five minutes.

120.name: Route 120
120.desc: Pokémon that can camouflage themselves hide in the rich wilds along this route.

121.name: Route 121
121.desc: This road leads to both the Safari Zone and Mt. Pyre. Many people set out along this route from Lilycove City.

122.name: Route 122
122.desc: People make their way to Mt. Pyre over this water route, reliving many precious memories as they traverse it.

123.name: Route 123
123.desc: This route offers a convenient path back to Mauville City from Mt. Pyre, but be aware that it is a one-way road.

124.name: Route 124
124.desc: This great stretch of ocean connects the cities of Lilycove, Mossdeep, and Sootopolis.

125.name: Route 125
125.desc: Small children are allowed to play in the waters of this sea route as far as Shoal Cave—but no further!

126.name: Route 126
126.desc: Even a pro swimmer would need three entire days to circuit around the crater containing Sootopolis City.

127.name: Route 127
127.desc: With no place to stop and rest in these waters, it is very hard for a swimmer to make it across this route.

128.name: Route 128
128.desc: The ocean floor beneath this water route is rumored to contain an undiscovered ruin.

129.name: Route 129
129.desc: Many Pokémon Trainers visit this route to train their Pokémon before challenging the Pokémon League.

130.name: Route 130
130.desc: This route was once a big topic of conversation due to a strange island that seemed to appear and then disappear.

131.name: Route 131
131.desc: It is the custom in Pacifidlog Town to swim a lap around this route before breakfast.

132.name: Route 132
132.desc: The children of Pacifidlog Town are said to be such strong swimmers that they frolic and play in these fierce currents.

134.name: Route 134
134.desc: This route is rather a famous diving spot among those who love exploring ancient ruins.

petalburgwoods.name: Petalburg Woods
petalburgwoods.desc: This dense forest, with its abundance of trees, is well known to be a favorite habitat for Shroomish.

rusturftunnel.name: Rusturf Tunnel
rusturftunnel.desc: This stone tunnel links together Rustboro and Verdanturf. Its name was chosen as a mixture of the two.

islandcave.name: Island Cave
islandcave.desc: The Island Cave is a location in Hoenn on a small island on Route 105.

granitecave.name: Granite Cave
granitecave.desc: This cavern is famous for its cave art, which depicts events from thousands of years ago.

abandonedship.name: Abandoned Ship
abandonedship.desc: The Abandoned Ship is a tattered, old ship that looks like it could carry passengers and cargo when it was in operation. This old ship has many rusted holes, broken doors and items of furniture scattered around rooms.

newmauville.name: New Mauville
newmauville.desc: Though it was planned to be a subterranean city extending 69 floors underground, this project died in development.

desert.name: Desert
desert.desc: The desert in the center of Route 111 cannot be traversed without the Go-Goggles.

miragetower.name: Mirage Tower
miragetower.desc: Some sections of floor inside are cracked and unstable, so a Mach Bike, which can quickly ride over the weak points before they crumble away, is required to reach the top.

desertpass.name: Desert Underpass
desertpass.desc: From its entrance on Route 114, the Desert Underpass extends eastward through the mountains of northern Hoenn, passing north of Fallarbor Town and Route 113.

mtchimney.name: Mt. Chimney
mtchimney.desc: This volcano towers to a height of nearly 5,000 feet. The view from its peak is beyond compare.

mountainpass.name: Mountain Pass
mountainpass.desc: This mountain path to Meteor Falls is so long and arduous that even Hikers have difficulty tackling it.

meteorfalls.name: Meteor Falls
meteorfalls.desc: This waterfall is said to have been the site of a meteor shower. An ancient people once made their home here.

mtpyre.name: Mt. Pyre
mtpyre.desc: The mountain is where spirits of Pokémon have rested and will always rest: past, present, and future.

shoalcave.name: Shoal Cave
shoalcave.desc: This cave's appearance changes greatly between high tide and low tide.

seafloorcavern.name: Seafloor Cavern
seafloorcavern.desc: It is said that a Pokémon once dwelled here in the ancient mists of a time long past.

skypillar.name: Sky Pillar
skypillar.desc: This tower was created for the veneration of a Legendary Pokémon that lives far above in the heavens.

trickhouse.name: Trick House
trickhouse.desc: It is owned by the Trick Master, who poses puzzling challenges to travelers. Those who wish to play his game must find their way through a maze-like puzzle at the back of his house. If successful, they will be rewarded.

safarizone.name: Safari Zone
safarizone.desc: This amusement area provides a rich environment in which to catch many different kinds of Pokémon.

mirageisland.name: Mirage Island
mirageisland.desc: Every day, a random number between 0 and 65535 is generated by the game. If this number matches the first two bytes of the personality value of any Pokémon in the player's party, then Mirage Island will appear.

farawayisland.name: Faraway Island
farawayisland.desc: The island is only accessible in Pokémon Emerald. Its location is marked on the Old Sea Map and Mr. Briney returns a favor to the player by helping them sail to this island on the ship moored in Lilycove City.
